title: Venator Awarded Prestigious Gold Medal from EcoVadis for Sustainability Performance - PR Newswire
summary: Venator Materials PLC, a global chemical manufacturer, has achieved a Gold Medal from EcoVadis, a leading sustainability rating organization. This recognition signifies Venator's commitment to environmental stewardship and sustainability, with its enhanced performance across environmental, labor, ethics, and sustainable procurement criteria. The Gold Medal places Venator among the top 4% of companies rated globally, demonstrating its progress towards its sustainability goals.

title: Novozymes, Chr. Hansen unveil name of future combined company - Aquafeed.com
summary: Novozymes and Chr. Hansen, two leading biosolutions companies, have merged to form Novonesis, a new entity aimed at developing innovative solutions for global challenges. The combined company will leverage its expertise in biological sciences and technology to offer biosolutions that address environmental and societal issues. The merger is expected to be completed in the first quarter of 2024.

title: Lezlee Westine Reflects on Her Tenure as President & CEO of Personal Care Products Council - Happi
summary: Lezlee Westine is retiring as president and CEO of the Personal Care Products Council (PCPC) after 14 years. Tom Myers, former executive vice president for legal & regulatory affairs and general counsel, has been appointed as her successor. Westine highlighted PCPC's accomplishments during her tenure, including the enactment of the Modernization of Cosmetics Regulation Act (MoCRA) of 2022, the development of a sustainability report and handbook, and the launch of the Madam C.J. Walker Award to recognize individuals committed to inclusivity and equality.

title: BWH Hotels and Call2Recycle Bring Battery Recycling Practices to the Canadian Hospitality Sector - GlobeNewswire
summary: Call2Recycle, a battery collection and recycling program, has partnered with BWH Hotels to implement battery recycling across BWH's Canadian hotel network. This initiative, part of BWH's global sustainability program, will provide a convenient and free solution for disposing of used batteries from hotel operations. The collaboration marks the first time a major hospitality company in Canada has integrated large-scale battery recycling as a core part of its sustainability strategy.

title: Ineos Inovyn Broadens PVC Product Portfolio with Expansion Initiative - ChemAnalyst
summary: Ineos Inovyn, a vinyl producer, has launched new PVC products with reduced carbon footprints and increased recycled content, aligning with the industry's move towards sustainability. The company introduced Biovyn, a bio-attributed PVC, Neovyn with a 37% lower carbon footprint compared to the European average, and Recovyn made entirely from recycled carbon feedstock. These innovations highlight Ineos Inovyn's commitment to reducing emissions and promoting circularity in the PVC industry.

title: Best Agrolife acquires 99% stake in Kashmir Chemicals - Indian Chemical News
summary: Best Agrolife Ltd. (BAL) has acquired a 99% stake in Kashmir Chemicals, a pesticide formulation manufacturer, to expand its manufacturing capacity and meet increasing demand for branded agrochemical products. The move is expected to increase BAL's overall returns by Rs. 350 crores and aligns with the company's focus on sustainable agriculture practices and environmental stewardship. BAL has also secured a patent for a new one-shot herbicide, 'Orisulam,' that is designed for paddy fields and will be introduced during the upcoming Kharif season.
